Question: What is the purpose of the 2-second rule?

Answers.Answer: To provide a safe following distance between vehicles traveling at the same speed
To ensure that vehicles have sufficient stopping time when approaching intersections
To avoid gridlocks in congested driving areas
To ensure the speed limit is observed

Question: You can stop or park your vehicle over a fire hydrant if someone stays with the vehicle who can move it.

Answers.Answer: failing to supply your correct name and address
having no warrant of fitness for your vehicle
failing to signal a right turn
failing to stop at a stop sign

Answers.Answer: Slow down so that you can look both ways to check that the crossing is clear
Speed up to drive over the crossing as quickly as possible
Stop to check whether the crossing is clear
Turn your vehicle indicators on before driving over the crossing

Use your vehicle brake lights (stop lights)

Question: What should you do when following another vehicle in wet conditions?

Answers.Answer: Drive closer to the vehicle so that you can follow in its tracks
Drive with your vehicle handbrake on

Question: If you are a driver involved in a crash, what is the FIRST action you should take?

Drive past at 20km/h until you pass the site of the crash

Tell a police officer as soon as possible
